text.autoconfig.itsthirst.title: Simple Thirst Config
text.autoconfig.itsthirst.option.damage_: Defines the damage taken every 4 seconds
Bigger values means more damage dealt to the player
text.autoconfig.itsthirst.option.general: Defines how quick the thirst level will go down
Bigger values means that the thirst will take more time to lower
text.autoconfig.itsthirst.option.drank_f: Defines in seconds the cooldown of that the player need to wait to drink water after drinking water from a water source with right click
Bigger values means more cooldown time
Defines in seconds the cooldown of that the player need to wait to drink water after drinking water from a rain with right click
Bigger values means more cooldown time
text.autoconfig.itsthirst.option.only_re: Only regen health if hunger and thirst bars are full
Defines if the player will only regen health if both hunger and thirst bars are full
False means the normal Minecraft bahaviour, where the player will regen health if the hunger bar is full, there is no interference from the thirst bar
text.autoconfig.itsthirst.option.bad_wat: Enable Bad Water
Defines if the player can have a chance to drink bad water when right clicking a water source or rain
True means that there is a chance that the water that the player drank is bad water
Default is: true
Apllies to rain
Defines if rain can be bad water
False means that rain will never be bad water
Default is: false
Bad Water from water source chance
Defines the chance of a water source being bad water
Bigger values means more chance of water source being a bad water
Default is: 0.75 (75%)
Bad Water from rain chance
Defines the chance of rain being bad water
Bigger values means more chance of rain being a bad water
Default is: 0.01
Bad Water Thirst Effect duration
Defines the duration of the thirst effect
Bigger values means that the thirst effect will last longer
Default is: 30 (30 seconds / 600 ticks)
Bad Water Thirst Effect factor
Defines how much of the player thirst the thirst effect will drain
Bigger values means that the thirst effect will drain more thirst
The value is based on the Minecraft exhaustion + amplifier
Default is: 0.05
text.autoconfig.itsthirst.option.should_: Low thirst level applies haste effect
Defines if the player should receive the haste effect when the thirst level is low
True means that if the thirst level is low the haste effect will be applied to the player
text.autoconfig.itsthirst.option.minimum: Minimum thirst level to apply haste effect
Defines how low the thirst level needs to be for the haste effect to be applied
Bigger means means that the haste effect will be applied if the player has more thirst level
text.autoconfig.itsthirst.option.should_: Low thirst level applies haste effect
Defines if the player should receive the haste effect when the thirst level is low
True means that if the thirst level is low the haste effect will be applied to the player
text.autoconfig.itsthirst.option.minimum: Minimum thirst level to apply mining fatigue effect
Defines how low the thirst level needs to be for the mining fatigue effect to be applied
Bigger values means means that the haste effect will be applied if the player has more thirst level
text.autoconfig.itsthirst.option.can_sta: Can stack empty bottles
Defines if the player can stack more then 1 empty bottle
False means the normal Minecraft behaviour, where the player can't stack more then 1 empty bottle
Warning 1: this effect only is applied if the player reconnects to the world
Default is: false
Can stack empty bottles factor
Defines empty bottles the player can stack
Bigger numbers means the player can stack more empty bottles
Warning: this effect only is applied if the player reconnects the world
Default is: 1
Can stack water bottles
Defines if the player can stack more then 1 water bottle
False means the normal Minecraft behaviour, where the player can't stack more then 1 water bottle
Warning 1: this effect only is applied if the player reconnects to the world
Warning 2: this effect will be applied to all items with 'minecraft:potion' name, so every bottle with special effects will be affected
Default is: false
Can stack water bottles factor
Defines how many water bottles the player can stack
Bigger numbers means the player can stack more water bottles
Warning: this effect only is applied if the player reconnects the world
Warning 2: this effect will be applied to all items with 'minecraft:potion' name, so every bottle with special effects will be affected
Default is: 1
text.autoconfig.itsthirst.option.can_eat: Can consume food items when thirst bar is not full
Set if the player can consume food items that lowers the thirst if the hunger bar is full but the thirst bar isn't
True means that the player will be able to consume food items that lowers the thirst even if the hunger bar is full while the thirst bar ins't
text.autoconfig.itsthirst.option.hydrati: How much thirst a drink tagged with #hydrating_drinks will refill
Bigger values means that a hydrating drink will refill more thirst
How much thirst a food tagged with #hydrating_foods will refill
Bigger values means that a hydrating food will refill more thirst
How much thirst a stew tagged with #hydrating_stews will refill
Bigger values means that a hydrating stew will refill more thirst
text.autoconfig.itsthirst.option.nether_: Makes the thirst bar lower more faster when the player is in the Nether
True means the thirst bar will lower more faster when the player is in the Nether
Defines how much more fast the thirst bar will lower if the player enabled the option 'Nether drains more thirst'
Bigger values means that the thirst bar will be drained faster
Defines the texture of the thirst bar when the player is in the Nether
1 means the red outline texture, 2 means the firy water dropplets, 3 means no special texture
